intro: Bersama gracilipes, commonly known as the slender balsam, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, palmate leaves. It produces clusters of pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Bersama gracilipes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
